Definition: In this task, we are given a Dialy Dialog Dataset, in which each conversation has multiple dialogues and each dialogues in the conversation is annotated based on emotion information, dialogue act as well as topic of converstaion. The dialogues in the dataset reflect our daily communication way and cover various topics about our daily life. Here we classify the data based on the dialogues emotion as positive examples if the emotion of happiness is present in the one of the dialogues of the conversation and output Yes otherwise if the emotion is sad then we classify it as negative examples and ouput No

Positive Examples.input: So Dick , how about getting some coffee for tonight ?  Coffee ? I don ’ t honestly like that kind of stuff .  Come on , you can at least try a little , besides your cigarette .  What ’ s wrong with that ? Cigarette is the thing I go crazy for .  Not for me , Dick .
Positive Examples.explanation: Here the first sentence indicates the soft tone and how exciting the speaker is for drinking coffee and it suggests overall happy tone.

Positive Examples.input: Would you mind waiting a while ?  Well , how long will it be ?  I'm not sure . But I'll get a table ready as fast as I can .  OK . We'll wait .
Positive Examples.explanation: Here the last sentence indicates that the speaker does not mind waiting for the table and happy with response of the other speake that he will get the table ready as fast as he can.

Positive Examples.input: Are you going to the annual party ? I can give you a ride if you need one .  Thanks a lot . That's the favor I was going to ask you for .  The pleasure is mine .
Positive Examples.explanation: Here the last two sentences expresses happiness by appreciating the gesture by other speaker for giving ride and he also responded happily saying pleasure is mine which suggests he liked giving the ride.

Negative Examples.input: Is everything to your satisfaction ?  No , the steak was recommended , but it is not very fresh .  Oh ! Sorry to hear that .
